abstract.p: David Link letter on how he deals with people conducting loud cell phone coversations in public (Sharon White Taylor's July 5 article); drawing

block.p: Sharon White Taylor calls for the ''cell phone police'' to enforce simple courtesy (Op-Ed, July 5), but she misses a more practical solution. If people decide to treat the entire world as their phone booth, it is only appropriate that they realize that other people are in it, too. And if they choose to forgo their privacy, it is only sensible for me to assume they have decided to include me in their conversation.

So I have no qualms about taking them up on the offer and adding helpful comments. If it's clear there's a boyfriend problem, or a lawyer problem, well, I've had boyfriend problems and lawyer problems.
